intro: Wulfenia houghtoniana, commonly known as Houghton's wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many flowering plants with bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect stems, narrow leaves, and showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Wulfenia houghtoniana is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
